definition: to raise enough money to do sth/to pool money/to club together (to do sth)
to gather together, pool or collect/to happen by chance/to move close to/to exploit an opportunity
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: The family clubbed together to buy the car.
sentences.chinese: 全家人湊錢買了這部小汽車。

sentences.english: We all pitched in to buy this gift .
sentences.chinese: 這是我們大夥湊錢給您買的禮物。

sentences.english: We did a whip-round to buy her a present.
sentences.chinese: 我們湊錢給她買了份禮物。

sentences.english: They pooled their money to buy a van.
sentences.chinese: 他們湊錢買了輛搬運車。

sentences.english: We are going to make a collection to buy flowers for Janet, who is ill in the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 我們打算湊錢給珍妮特買花，她已住進醫院。

sentences.english: We clubbed together to buy our teacher a present.
sentences.chinese: 我們湊錢給老師買了件禮物。

sentences.english: The explorers pooled their resources and bought a boat by which they began to search for the source of the river.
sentences.chinese: 探險家們湊錢買了條船，並憑此開始勳章河流的源頭。

sentences.english: In the second problem the two groups had to club together to pay for the movie they wanted to watch.
sentences.chinese: 在第二個問題中，兩組人需要一起湊錢去看一場電影。

sentences.english: Everybody chipped in to buy the teacher a gold watch when he retired.
sentences.chinese: 老師退休的時候，大家湊錢給他買了塊金錶。

sentences.english: The students clubbed together to buy their teacher a present.
sentences.chinese: 學生們湊錢給他們的老師買了件禮物。

sentences.english: The office chipped in and sided with us.
Just like classmates across the country, they all chipped in to buy a classmate a birthday gift.
sentences.chinese: 和全國一樣，他們湊錢給同班同學買了一份生日禮物。

sentences.english: Yun-shen working partners to raise money to help them, chipped in to help gathering pace to complete the operation.
sentences.chinese: 雲生的工作夥伴們集資相助，湊錢幫助雲生完成手術。

sentences.english: Letwouls ingl chip in and get Phil a retirement gift.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們一起湊錢給菲爾買一件退休禮物吧。
